p: Flagellum-based motility and biofilm formation have also been implicated in virulence (Josenhans and Suerbaum, 2002; Duan et al., 2013). The biosynthesis of flagella is temperature-dependent, since most L. monocytogenes strains produce flagella and are motile only at temperatures of 30Â°C and less (Peel et al., 1988). Flagellum-mediated motility is critical both for initial surface attachment and subsequent biofilm formation (Lemon et al., 2007).
